ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My Spanish grammar improved greatly, especially my ability to write and speak using complicated grammatical tenses.
This course really helped me develop a more sophisticated and comfortable command of writing. As a non-native learner, I feel much more confident in my understanding of the Spanish language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Our class only had 6 people, so it was impossible to hide and easy to ask questions. The movies were long and not that helpful, but the conversation partners were a great way to practice Spanish in a low stakes situation.

Strengths: I really appreciated the variety of learning resources in the curriculum, from the online homework quizzes to the movies. In the classroom, I really benefited from the partner exercises and the level of attention/dedication that the professor gave to each student. I also found the textbook to be really comprehensive and useful. Weaknesses: Homework load was a bit tedious at times. I also hoped we could spend more time discussing the readings/movies during class because I did not always understand them clearly when I read them by myself.
Strengths: does a good job of teaching grammar Weaknesses: some of the homework is repetitive and feels like busy work

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This class had a lot of work that sometimes felt a little bit tedious. But if you're committed to improving Spanish grammar, I would really recommend it.

I'd 100% recommend this course, especially to non-native Spanish learners looking to improve their writing skills. I felt that this course was a good fit for me since I had previously studied Spanish in high school, so it was not only a great review of grammar concepts that I was already somewhat familiar with, but also an opportunity to study it more in greater depth. Additionally, the engaging professor and wide variety of resources heavily influenced my impression.
Definitely, take it with Professor Seymour, she is the greatest!
Lots of busy work. If you take it, take it credit/D. Seymour is an excellent professor.
Yes, it's good for building a strong grammatical foundation
